title: Get the status of an async report task

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. Please use the same access token as the /report/task/create/ point.

parameters.name: advertiser_id
parameters.description: Advertiser ID. Note : If you use advertiser_ids when calling /report/task/create/ (POST method), you need to set this field to one of the Advertiser IDs specified via advertiser_ids .

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ID of the asynchronous report task. You can get the ID via the response of /report/task/create/ endpoint.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: The response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: The response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the task. Enum values: QUEUING , PROCESSING , SUCCESS , FAILED , CANCELED . If you want to cancel a task that is either queued or currently being processed, use /report/task/cancel/ .

fields.name: message
fields.description: This field is returned when status is FAILED . The reason why the task failed.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: The unique ID of the request.
